subject: CBS Evening News with Katie Couric E-Mail Alert
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
Late breaking news on Capitol Hill tonight as Congress
  prepares to send President Bush legislation that would call for the
  withdrawal of troops to start this October. After days of harsh words between
  the administration and the Democratic leadership about the vote, the White
  House remains steadfast about President Bush’s plans to veto this
  legislation, Sharyl Attkisson will report.
 
David Martin will give a Reality Check on the state
  of the troop surge in Iraq,
  how it’s working and where funds are needed most on the ground there.
 
Next, Bob Orr will have an update on a story he
  broke for CBS News about the case of a man who calls himself The Bishop. This
  morning, federal authorities arrested a man suspected of sending threatening
  letters and two dud pipe bombs. We’ll have more details on the case and
  the arrest.
 
When John McCain started campaigning months ago for
  the Republican nomination, he was the presumed front-runner. Now that he has
  trailed Rudy Giuliani and Mitt Romney in polls, he’s attempting to
  breathe life into his campaign. Today, McCain formally declared his
  candidacy, and Jim Axelrod will have the full story.
 
Residents of Eagle
    Pass, Texas, say
  they can’t remember the last time a tornado struck their area. But the
  one that came to town yesterday was a monster – destroying two schools,
  killing at least 11 people and damaging scores of homes. Elsewhere, flooding
  and high winds took their toll. Hari Sreenivasan will survey the damage.
 
Ask a kid their favorite food, and you’re
  likely to hear chips, cookies or other sugar- or fat-loaded snacks. What
  happens when a school reforms the way kids eat? Nancy Cordes will show you.
 
Finally, we’ll tell you about what could be a
  planet a lot like Earth. It seems to be roughly the same temperature and size,
  and may even have water. The hitch: it is 120 trillion miles away. Sandra
  Hughes will have more.
 
I hope you’ll join us.
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
